title: upgrade twilio node library
body: A [new version of the Twilio node library](https://www.twilio.com/blog/2017/05/next-generation-node-helper-library-release.html) is available.

title: Mark a message 'unread'
body:
Suggested by a current user:

As a case manager, I want to mark a message unread so I'll remember to come back and respond to it later.

title: the alert for new messages received doesn't refresh with new info without page reload
body:
1. You have no messages and there's no alert.
2. You receive a message; an alert saying "You have 1 unread message" appears.
3. You receive another message; the alert never updates to say "You have 2 unread messages".
4. Reload the page, or go to any page in the site, and when the alert appears, it will have the correct text.

title: apostrophes sent from an iPhone disappear from the message received in ClientComm
body: Sending We're looks like Were, and It's looks like Its.

title: cursor focus should be in message field when you click in to "send message" form
body: Clicking "start typing message" at the bottom of the message stream opens a form where you're invited to enter your message, but you have to click again in the form field to give it cursor focus. It should automatically have focus.

title: typing a message and pressing "send later" doesn't preserve your message
body: If you type a message in the field at the bottom of the message stream and press "send later", you're taken to a form that prompts you for a type of communication, and, if you select "write message", prompts you for a time, but then doesn't preserve your original message, which you have to retype.

title: on client profile page, under Recent Activity, dates for last inbound and outbound messages are incorrect
body: They look like this: might make sense to have them be relative? Like "4 Days Ago".

title: revamp "notification sent" alert
body: When a notification a case manager scheduled is sent, they are given an alert that looks like this: The alert isn't very informative. It tells you that a notification was sent, and the subject of the message (which isn't seen by the recipient). Instead, it should: - tell you who the notification was sent to - tell you when the notification was sent - be a link that takes you to the conversation stream

title: Save unsent messages in progress
body:
Suggested by a user.

If you have to leave a current text to respond to another, it'd be nice to return to the page and have the text you were writing preloaded in the form.

title: Revamp client list view
body:
Suggestions from a PO in Multnomah:
- Remove 'transfer' and 'transcript' buttons from client list since those are rarely needed
- Have a button that takes you directly to all of client's contact info
- Have a button that lets you send that client a text (I think the PO would like to send a text directly from the client list screen, as opposed to having to send the text within the message stream)
- Default sort by last activity, or allow a PO to choose their own default sort option

title: Add ability to create multiple new contact methods with a new client
body: **User story** As a PO, I want to add multiple contact methods when I'm creating a client so I don't have to go through the flow multiple times. **Solution** When adding a new client, on the new contact method screen we should have a link to "+ Add another contact method", which reveals a set of additional inputs for another contact method. **Rough design** Expanded:

title: Add ability to set "out of office" message outside working hours
body:
PO requested that he can set his working hours, so if someone texts him outside those hours, the client would receive an automatic message (something to the effect of "This is an automatic message - [PO] is unavailable between 5pm to 8am. If this is an emergency, call XYZ. Otherwise, they will review your message when they're in the office tomorrow.")

More of a nice-to-have than a need-to-have, but I like that it lets a PO set his/her boundaries, and is also transparent for clients and sets expectations.

title: Editing a client / contact method could be improved
body:
The UX on editing a client and their contact methods is pretty clunky. Right now if I go into a client and click the "edit" button, I can only edit their name / DOB. I have to go to a separate screen for contact methods, and on that screen I can only edit existing contact methods. To add a new contact method, I need to go to a _new_ button in the top nav.

Ideally, editing a client allows you to edit both the client's info, and their contact methods (and add a new contact method). This requires some design work, but is something we should fix soon.

![apr-13-2017 11-17-36](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5083453/25018150/302043be-203b-11e7-88cb-e41bbc158d6e.gif)

title: Change "title" field for adding a new contact method
body:
The "title" field on the new contact method is confusing. A PO suggested we change the input to "Label" and give an example, so it's clearer what we're asking (he thought "title" referred to Dr., Mr., Mrs., etc).

We could simply do this UI improvement, or we could make the UX of adding a contact method a little easier. For example, we could auto-fill the label based on the contact method type (i.e. the field is pre-filled "Joe's Cellphone"), and a PO can edit the label if he/she wants.

title: Swap "send later" and "send now" buttons
body: I observed a PO who kept almost clicking "send later" instead of "send now" because it's the first button next to the message screen. He suggested swapping these buttons, which makes sense but might cause confusion for SLCO users who are used to the current order. I'd suggest we just improve the design here, so "send now" is more visible / has more emphasis, and "send later" is a secondary option.

title: Add ability to receive pictures
body:
A PO who works with DV offenders & victims requested the ability to receive pictures. I know sending pictures isn't possible right now (nor does it really sound critical for case managers), but receiving pictures sounded important for him (and something he currently is able to get via texting on his iPhone with clients). 

No idea how feasible this is! If it's easy to do, it sounded worthwhile. If it's complicated, we should see if we can at least send an error message back to whoever sent the message that their photo didn't go through.

title: Add spellcheck
body: PO requested that we include spellcheck when typing a message. Not sure if this would be annoying for POs typing in another language (i.e. Spanish), but it sounded like something that would be valuable.

title: Increase click target in client list view
body: When I was in Multnomah, I observed POs trying to get into a message stream by clicking anywhere in the row of the client list. Right now the only way to get into a message stream is to click the client's name, which is hard if the client has a short name ("John Doe"). We should make it so that clicking anywhere in the row (other than the edit/transcript/transfer/archive buttons) takes a user to the message stream.

title: Ability to send to multiple contact methods at once
body:
**User story**
As a PO, I want to send one message to multiple contact methods for a client, so that I don't have to retype the same message over and over again.

**Background**
Some clients have multiple contact methods associated (primary cell phone, partner's cell phone, lawyer's phone, etc). POs in Multnomah requested the ability to select multiple contact methods when sending a message, so they can message the client and the lawyer at the same time with the same message.

**Note**
We'd need to do some UX and design investigation and work here to make sure this is seamless, but I think it's a really interesting idea. I don't know if POs want to have multiple threads going in the same message stream, or if they'd want a filter, etc. One potential workaround is to automatically create (and update) a group for all contact methods associated with a client, so a PO can send a group message out...idk. Worth investigating!

title: fix errors and automate manual aspects of provision and deploy process
body:
In the process of setting up a new instance of clientcomm I ran into a few things that could be fixed, documented, improved, or automated:

- [ ] Finalize and document the process for managing multiple deploys with [terraform state environments](https://www.terraform.io/docs/state/environments.html)
- [ ] Could the [deploy script](https://github.com/slco-2016/clientcomm/blob/master/devTools/deploy) automate the database migration and bower install detailed in the [Initializing the app](https://github.com/slco-2016/clientcomm/tree/master/deploy#initializing-the-app) section of the deploy README?
- [ ] [This commented-out line](https://github.com/slco-2016/clientcomm/blob/master/deploy/clientcomm.tf#L437) in clientcomm.tf gets written into the `clientcomm.conf` file on the deployed servers, which errors if you try to export the file to env variables
- [ ] Document that a *new hosted zone* must be created for the new deploy's URL (i.e. `sanfrancisco.clientcomm.org`, and an NS record be created in the `clientcomm.org` hosted zone with the new zone's name servers. (This is because there's a wildcard A record in the `clientcomm.org` hosted zone that intercepts requests for subdomains unless they're explicitly noted)
- [ ] Once the mailgun record sets are created, you'll have to [verify the domain setup](https://documentation.mailgun.com/user_manual.html#verifying-your-domain) on the mailgun site. Also, the mailgun SMTP password (`TF_VAR_mailgun_smtp_password`) is a value that can be retrieved from mailgun and is expected in the environment variables. These details should be added to the deploy README.
- [x] The [initialize deploy script](https://github.com/slco-2016/clientcomm/blob/master/devTools/initializeDeploy.js) isn't working on the new servers; it hangs when trying to access the database. Figure out why and fix it.

title: verify bundled.ejs isn't used, remove it
body: [bundled.ejs](https://github.com/slco-2016/clientcomm/blob/master/app/views/partials/bundled.ejs), an ejs partial with some javascript setup code, doesn't seem to be used anywhere. Verify this and delete it and/or move its code elsewhere in the app where it will be used.

title: Creating a group with 0 or 1 client results in an error
body:
Steps to replicate:
1. As a case manager user, I go to the "+ Groups" button
2. I enter my group name, select 0 or 1 client, and save group

Result:
I get this screen of death:
![screenshot 2017-03-14 21 40 56](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5083453/23933941/29da38c8-08ff-11e7-99fc-aaeb7896a4c8.png)

Note: After I got this screen, I used my browser's back button and saw the group in my group list. I sent a test message to it and got a confirmation on screen, but the message never actually sent (I didn't get it on my phone). I think that the group wasn't actually created (per the error message above), even though the UI seems to indicate it was.

title: mailgun can't connect to remote server, retries, fails
mailgun is throttling when we try to send too many emails near the same time
body: We're seeing this error in the mailgun logs regularly: `421 #4.4.5 Too many connections from your host.` All the throttled emails get sent eventually, but it'd be nice to queue emails to send at a rate that mailgun can accept.

title: allow case managers to send files to clients
body: i.e. images, PDFs, etc. Requested by a case manager today.

title: implement an automated method for monitoring the clientcomm worker process
body:
ideas:
- the process pings a service that alerts when it hasn't heard from it for a while
- we create an endpoint showing past-due notifications and alert when any notification passes a certain age.

title: Case Manger couldn't send messages after a contact method was deleted
body: I deleted a contact method from an account. Afterwards the case manager couldn't send messages from the form at the bottom of the messages page, even when a valid phone number was chosen in the dropdown. But when they sent a message via the `clients/{n}/address` form and selected the same number, the message was sent.

title: add date/time to worker process log entries
body:
currently just looks like:

```
Cleared msg 12345
Cleared msg 12346
```

title: notifications & scheduled voice mail messages are not sent at the indicated time
body: I scheduled a voice message for 5pm, it was sent at 4:38pm. @tdooner mentioned in #360 that a message scheduled for 8pm was sent at 8:12pm.

title: outbound and inbound voice messages are not distinguished from each other visually
body:
Outbound and inbound voice messages in a message stream look identical (solid rect, left-justified), unlike outbound (outline rect, right-justified) and inbound (solid rect, left-justified) sms messages. Outbound messages of any type should be styled the same way.

![screen shot 2017-02-24 at 11 00 00 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/546665/23316761/9ed02daa-fa80-11e6-8cbd-ffcde686b9ce.png)

The outbound voice message also says it was "received via" rather than "sent to" the client.
